Profile.title: Profile
Profile.relationshipDescription: Here you can see the accounts shared with you, as well as the namespaces you have access to. New clients will see this section empty.

PermissionsDetails.title: What can you do with your current permissions?

staff.title: Super user
staff.subtitle: Super users
staff.abountContent:
Users with the power to perform high-level actions in the system, such as promoting qualified users to staff or manager roles. Due to the significant level of access and control, this role should be assigned with extreme caution.

Additionally, users of this type share the same permissions as manager users.

manager.title: Manager
manager.subtitle: Super users
manager.abountContent:
Users with the power to perform high-level actions in the system, but subordinate to super users (staff).

Accounts with these permissions are closely tied to the system itself. They can manage namespaces, accounts, system roles, webhooks, and other resources.

accountManager.title: Account Manager
accountManager.subtitle: High-level permissions
accountManager.abountContent: The Account Manager role spans the entire account and allows managing accounts and guests of a specific account. This role is crucial for maintaining a secure and user-friendly environment for all users.

gatewayManager.title: Gateway Manager
gatewayManager.subtitle: High-level permissions
gatewayManager.abountContent: The Gateway Manager is a role that spans the entire gateway and allows viewing and managing routes and services. This role has system-wide scope but read-only privileges.

guestManager.title: Guest Manager
guestManager.subtitle: High-level permissions
guestManager.abountContent:
The Guest Manager is a system-wide role that allows managing guest roles across all tenants. Roles created with this permission will be applied to all tenants, ensuring a consistent and secure experience for guests throughout the system.

This role is essential for maintaining a secure and user-friendly environment for all users.

subscriptionsManager.title: Subscriptions Manager
subscriptionsManager.subtitle: High-level permissions
subscriptionsManager.abountContent:
The Subscriptions Manager is a tenant-wide role that allows managing subscriptions across one or more tenants. Actions performed by this role include creating and updating subscriptions, as well as managing associated resources and settings.

The Subscriptions Manager can also invite users to a specific subscription account. Managing account tags and metadata is also permitted.

systemManager.title: System Manager
systemManager.subtitle: High-level permissions
systemManager.abountContent:
The System Manager must handle issues and resources across the entire system. Their impact is global, so they should exercise caution when making changes.

System Managers should handle less critical issues such as error code management and high-level configurations like webhook setup.

tenantOwner.title: Tenant Owner
tenantOwner.subtitle: High-level permissions
tenantOwner.abountContent:
You are a tenant owner. This means you have full access to one or more tenants and can manage them as well as their associated accounts and guests.

The tenant owner has full access to tenant resources, including account management, metadata, tags, and settings.

tenantManager.title: Tenant Manager
tenantManager.subtitle: High-level permissions
tenantManager.abountContent:
The Tenant Manager is a role that spans all tenants and allows managing a single tenant.

Actions performed by this role include creating and updating tenant settings as well as managing associated resources such as accounts, metadata, and tags.

customRoles.title: Custom roles
customRoles.subtitle: High-level permissions
customRoles.abountContent: Custom roles are used in the management of downstream services. See the list of your custom roles.

LicensedResourcesSection.title: Accounts you have access to
